definition: abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)

sentences.english: Christopher Marlowe is one of the outstanding representatives of English Renaissance dramatists.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯托弗馬洛是文藝復興時期英國戲劇的傑出代表。

sentences.english: Refusing to be discouraged, Christopher took a few more breaths the next day.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯托弗毫不氣餒，第二天又多呼吸了幾次。

sentences.english: Renee Terrell says her boyfriend Christopher Luttrell is the killer.
sentences.chinese: 特雷爾說她的男友克里斯托弗“魯特瑞爾纔是兇手。

sentences.english: Christopher Hitchens was once asked about his opinions on the issue of climate change.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯托弗希欽斯曾被問及他對氣候變化問題的意見。

sentences.english: In December, 2003, Christopher was living in the town of Palmyra.
sentences.chinese: 2003年12月，克里斯托弗住在巴爾米拉城。

sentences.english: Kristoff rides Sven as they follow the trail of ice.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯托弗騎着斯文，沿着冰形成的尾跡跟隨着他們。
1983年聖克里斯托弗和尼維斯獨立。

sentences.english: Christo was a terrific correspondent and wrote letters to friends every day.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯托弗是一個了不起的記者，會每天給朋友寫信。

sentences.english: Christopher had broken his spinal cord near the base of his skull, resulting in paralysis from the neck down.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯托弗顱腔底部的脊柱折斷了，頸部以下癱瘓。

sentences.english: From that moment on, Christopher thought only about living.
sentences.chinese: 從那一刻開始，克里斯托弗一心只想着活下去。

sentences.english: Now it is at Christopher Street and Sheridan Square.
sentences.chinese: 現在它已停靠在克里斯托弗街和謝立丹廣場站了。

sentences.english: EMGF fund is managed by Christopher Jacobson and John Athanasiou.
sentences.chinese: EMGF基金由克里斯托弗雅各布森和約翰阿薩納修。
